citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A rabbit was observed by APHIS with yellow-tinged crusted material around the nose. This rabbit’s respiratory effort was
elevated, which may be related to the yellow-tinged nasal material. The rabbit's feet were also stained yellow and matted.
The attending veterinarian had not been consulted about this issue prior to the inspection. These symptoms may be
caused by a serious underlying disease and constitute a significant welfare concern.
The facility must establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods
to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and the availability of emergency, weekend, and holiday care under the
guidance of an attending veterinarian. The facility must ensure that the attending veterinarian is informed of this issue and
must follow their plan for veterinary care. To be corrected by April 15, 2025.

This facility's contingency plan has not been reviewed since July 1, 2022. Failure to conduct annual contingency plan
reviews reduces the capability for disaster response and may impact animal welfare in the event of disasters. The facility
must ensure that the contingency plan is reviewed annually and that this review is documented. Additionally, this
documentation must be available to APHIS upon request. Correct by April 29, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
